description.plain:
Billy Woods (stylized billy woods) is an American alternative hip hop artist based in New York City. The founder of the record label Backwoodz Studioz and one half of duo Armand Hammer, Woods does not show his face in press photos or videos unless it’s obscured by a mask or by digitized fuzz.

Genius.com makes me very sad about the state of reading comprehension in the US. Sometimes I want to tell them: “This song is about a date I went on, not the devastating toll of capitalism and racism.” They come in with preconceived ideas and the belief that a song can only mean one thing, which is the strangest way to approach my music.

– billy woods, The Guardian

Born in Washington D.C., his mother is a Jamaican professor and feminist writer while his father, a writer and an intellectual, was a political refugee from Zimbabwe who was involved in the country’s independence movement while it was still known as Rhodesia. In 1980, after peace negotiations began, the family moved to Africa and soon after his father became a member of the government who ruled the country in the 80s. In 1989, after Woods’s father passed away the previous year, they returned to Washington.

Woods began making music in the late 1990s after moving to New York to attend college and meeting Vordul Mega of seminal underground rap duo Cannibal Ox, who encouraged him to start writing and rapping. During the 2000s he was member of duo Super Chron Flight Brothers (with another rapper, Priviledge) and collective The Reavers, as well as active as a solo artist.

I don’t make music to make people feel comfortable or reaffirm all the things that they already thought. If you listen to a whole album and never had to question one of your beliefs or your opinions about the world, or yourself, then you weren’t really listening. I want to make the true believers as uncomfortable as the hardened cynics because both of them are doing the same thing: Trying to protect themselves from the true nature of this world, in its staggering beauty and its infinite horrors. I am here to plunge a knife into the gaps in that makeshift armor, so you can feel it, see the blood and know that there is no protection.

– billy woods, Brooklyn Magazine

songs.title: Asylum

description.plain:
In “Asylum,” billy woods describes his life as a child in Zimbabwe, in an affluent family that is falling apart, all within the context of the current political turmoil.

In the second verse, he eerily describes the situation of Mengistu Haile Mariam, the former dictator of Ethiopia, after having fled to Zimbabwe.

The song is wrapped up – and the connection between the two verses is drawn – with a clip from “Kongi’s Harvest” (1970), which describes the darker side of living in a gilded cage.

songs.embed_content: Read “Asylum” by ​billy woods on Genius

body.plain:
In “Asylum,” billy woods describes his life as a child in Zimbabwe, in an affluent family that is falling apart, all within the context of the current political turmoil.

The song is wrapped up – and the connection between the two verses is drawn – with a clip from “Kongi’s Harvest” (1970), which describes the darker side of living in a gilded cage.

songs.full_title: Billy Woods - Asylum (Русский перевод)* by Genius Russian Translations (Русские переводы)
songs.title: Billy Woods - Asylum (Русский перевод)*

songs.lyrics:
32 ContributorsTranslationsРусскийAsylum Lyrics
I think Mengistu Haile Mariam is my neighbor
Whoever it is moved in and put an automated gate up
Repainted brick walls atop which now cameras rotated
By eight, the place dark, one light burn later
Razor wire like a slinky
Rumor is parcel bomb took the secretary right eye and pinky
Evenings, he take a snifter of whisky on the veranda
I wonder what he's thinking
In the morning, the maid brings coffee from the kitchen
Some nights strange music plays, I lay in bed and listen
Downstairs I hear my mother breaking dishes, my father trippin'
It's been quite bad lately, high tension
Galvanized steel security fencin'
To get through the day, give myself a mission
Anything what get me out the house a blessin'
His bodyguard chews khat, spits black in the rhododendron
Blacked out Range rumble when he start the engine
Avocado tree hang over the property line
I watch from as high as I can climb
The dog looks up and whines, the hills are alive with land mines
I live in my mind
Not sure what I'm looking for, but I'll know when I find
My mother sent the gardener to look for me, but the sky is a great place to hide
Never told the truth in your life? Can't start now
Ever so slowly, slowly locked up in your own house
Never told the truth in your life? Can't start now
Ever so slowly, slowly locked up in your own house
You might also like
The guests start having doubts, the host nowhere to be found
It's ghosts in the building's bones, so many skeletons in the ground
When everything collapse, he just melt into the crowd
Suitcase packed, melted down the crown
But a haven's only safe as long as they want you around
Tomorrow it's no tellin'
Hollow when you done sellin'

You see how well they treat me? My own courtyard for private strolls. And in my chalet, every possible amenity, not to mention the occasional night visitors
I must confess kabiyesi, this detention seems to look well on you
But, so does captivity look well on a lamb we are fattening up for the feast. Or, perhaps as you say, on a wife we treat with special favor because she is going to bear us a child. What happens when the great day comes and there is only a calabash under the wrapper3Embed

songs.title: No Hard Feelings

description.plain:
The second track off of billy woods' album ‘Aethiopes’.

The song describes the struggles of living in the slums in vivid details. These include topics of drug use, selfish people, and the unfortunate mortality rate.

The song has an unconventional song structure, something woods' isn’t a stranger of doing. The song has no chorus, or hook, but two verses that come one after another. The first verse is notably longer than the other. The only clear distinction that separates the two verses is the perspective. While still following the same themes of the song the second verse is from the perspective of someone who is being stood up by a woman. The first verse was about a more broad scope of going through the life of someone living in the ghetto.

The title of the song comes from the only sentence that is repeated at length within the song. “No hard feelings” is repeated five times total in the song. Most of these times are at the end of the first verse after being told not to smoke in the building, but the phrase comes back around at the end of the second verse being re contextualized as it coming from a phone call the next day from the woman who stood the person up.

songs.embed_content: Read “No Hard Feelings” by ​billy woods on Genius

songs.lyrics:
29 ContributorsNo Hard Feelings Lyrics
Black astronaut, cop a space suit and jet off my steps
Challenger launch burnin' bright, burn to death
Burn in the firmament, charbroiled, catch the hair
Black boy burned crisp, pursed black lips
Black marionettes dance limp over the pit
The kindly ones distant as the winter's sun
A mad woman whistlin', you can hear it if you listen
That's that empty pipe hissin', that's him crying and twitchin'
That's the vanishing point in the distance
Between us just the glass thickness
Cracked mirrors flash rictus
Skin pulled tight to the skull, that's the sickness
Seepin' through my leaky windows and broke fixtures
Guess who in the vestibulе like, "you can't smoke that herе mister"
Nah man, you can't smoke that here (Gotta go, man. You gotta go)
No hard feelings, no hard feelings, no hard feelings
It's scars when you done healing
It's walls topped with broken glass, I'll show you slum village
It's thoughts that come back from the grave, again and again, grinnin'
It's winnin', it's winnin', it's winnin', it's winnin'
Brother hopped out that new car smellin' like no hard feelings
Aftertaste bitter melon and lemon peelings
Heat rises so it's high ceilings
I pay rent on the tenth like they stealin'
Like they stealin' (like they stealin'), like they stealin'
If the nigga by the furnace in the basement of the building
You might also like
After all that, she no-showed
The suite already paid for, so I toweled the door and smoked dope
Kulture Kush crossed True Gold
After a couple of texts, I left it alone (Left it alone)
Ice melted but the champagne still cold
Channel flippin', clickin' the remote
The home team losin' at home
An attack on the train, persons unknown
Baking shows, cold cases solved and closed
I dozed, woke up and "no hard feelings" was all it said on my phone2Embed

songs.lyrics:
34 ContributorsRemorseless Lyrics
Burnt offering in the desert
Shining city up on the hill, I burned it like Nebuchadnezzar
This world, hard to even take its measure
Three rooms filled with Incan treasure
Still strangled the king 'cause it's now or never
It's a freedom in admitting it's not gonna get better
Washing your hands of people you known forever
I'd be a liar if I feign surprise, a goat eats where it's tethered
Treat African proverbs like Vegas flyers, I float above the peasants
Too clever by half, halftime down twenty
I'm not that good at math, but common sense, I got plenty
(It's fuckin' over)
In person, these rappers' watches look temptin'
The chain say envy, but PTSD keep me countin', never spendin'
My accountant is a head full of bad memories and sad endings
It's all payment pending
I'm not concerned with generational wealth, that's its own curse
Anything you want on this cursed Earth
Probably better off gettin' it yourself, see what it's worth

The photograph of young Tutankhamun
Spaghetti links tangled like ramen
Everything behind the mask rotten
I tell people I keep it so you not forgotten, but that's cap
I thought pillars of salt, but she too smart for lookin' back
Mid-eighties in the rear-view of a gold Mercedes
Midday sun make the crocodiles lazy
Money phone pocket dial, run come save me
Sweet old ladies poisoning pigeons in the park
For a lark, make mine strychnine, life is a zipline in the dark
Spare me the Hallmark Karl Marx
I was in the Dollar Tree break-room playin' cards with quarters
Stop loss posters on the wall, brick and mortar
I watched the planet from orbit, remorseless

(It is therefore decreed, that as a warning to all other enemies of state...)
(...these recent saboteurs shall be publicly hanged)
Cut it, cut it off. Has no one here . Cut it
Kabiyesi
Come back here, you!

songs.full_title: Sauvage by ​billy woods (Ft. Boldy James & Gabe 'Nandez)
songs.title: Sauvage

description.plain: “Sauvage” is the fourth track off of billy woods & Preservation’s Aethiopes. The title is the French word for ‘savage,’ which is by design. It refers to the European definition of what savagery is. It links back to the central theme of the album as Europeans seemingly justified their colonization of Africa as a mission to civilize the people that lived there, freeing them of their ‘savage’ nature.

description.plain: NYNEX has the members of Armand Hammer and Crown Nation tackling racial and religious themes. NYNEX Corporation was an American telephone company serving New York and five states in New England between 1984 and 1997.

songs.full_title: The Man Who Would Be King by ​billy woods
songs.title: The Man Who Would Be King
songs.title_with_featured: The Man Who Would Be King

description.plain: Like many songs on History Will Absolve Me, “The Man Who Would Be King” is about colonialism and imperialism, specifically the subjugation of Africa under “the white man’s burden.” Billy references Rudyard Kipling in the song’s title and lyrics, and elsewhere describes Biblical battles and historical exoduses. The chorus implies that despite the triumphal onslaught of imperialism in late 19th century Africa, neither the Europeans nor Africans have won in the end.

The chorus implies that despite the triumphal onslaught of imperialism in late 19th century Africa, neither the Europeans nor Africans have won in the end.

songs.full_title: The World Is Yours by Nas
songs.title: The World Is Yours

songs.lyrics:
36 ContributorsThe Man Who Would Be King Lyrics
Mogambo, the new world in motion picture entertainment
Mogambo, unforgettable adventure in untamed Africa
Africa, known for centuries as the white man's graveyard
The heat and fury of the jungle tears
The veneer of civilization from these women
No holds are barred as they fall in love with a man who lives for adventure

Facing existential threats, my advice, kill ‘em dead
No regrets, the devil’s rejects writ large
Observe the precepts of a benevolent god
Blue-eyed Prometheans in the heart of darkness.
Land of the monsters. Walk like Quetzalcoatl amongst the conquered
Dick hard
Put myself in the stars, his woman in the dirt
Face down, ass up, doing God’s work
Go native, the world is yours. (It’s mine, it’s mine, it’s mine)
The sound of Maxim's gun still sends a chill up my spine
Empire of the Sun, never sets
A Christian’s duty is never done
You can bet on significant returns to all shareholders
King Solomon's mines, just give me a hundred experienced soldiers
The knowledge of good and evil, sweet nothings whispered by cobras
Useless baubles given to greedy chiefs
Lies told with the practiced ease of an old thief
When they hung the poor nigga, I felt a certain relief
You might also like
(No time for discretion... I think I'm gonna run out of bullets before they run out of spears.)

Take up your burden, the savage wars of peace
Fill full the mouth of famine and bid the sickness cease
And when your goal is nearest, the end for others sought
Watch sloth and heathen folly bring all your hopes to nought

Gold ill-gotten with guts and gleaming Martin-Henry Guns
With that holy trinity, who can argue my divinity under two red suns
Return like Kipling’s dead son, summoned by monkey paw
A thousand Philistines slain with a donkey’s jaw
Gave them the rule of law, schools, roads, jobs, clothed and shod
Still, they fled to the land of Nod
Eden's East, upon his brow, Mark of the Beast
Empire fat like a cow, slaughtered for the feast
The stink of a Jackal’s teeth

The forest inexorably growing as Kinshasa crumbles

songs.title: Christine

description.plain: The title of the song references the novel Christine, by Stephen King, which is about a haunted, murderous car. About Christine, woods says: “I really liked Christine a lot. That’s probably one of the books I’ve read the most in my life.” The woods verses reference cars in various ways through his verses, and notably in the chorus, which references a a three-wheeled coffin that a ghost rides in.

That’s probably one of the books I’ve read the most in my life.” The woods verses reference cars in various ways through his verses, and notably in the chorus, which references a a three-wheeled coffin that a ghost rides in.

(... Strawberry on deck, Strawberry already with three hits tonight!)
Asleep at the wheel
Gently over the guardrail, flipped heads or tails
One died, she survived

Ducked the question
In a hospital room full of flowers, I plucked the best one
In a world full of cowards, it's bound to be tension

 behind on  with a single, he got behind on Butler and lined-out, it's now 2-0
Daniels' with a game situation here
If he can work his way aboard, then the load falls once again on Daryl Strawberry
As he has a chance to play hero once again for the Dodgers
But it's up to Daniels at this point
Fuck 23 and Me, mom's an inventor
From our DNA to Cambridge, Mass
Maafe, that's Skippy and poulet
Dispatched from Venice,  Kilgari
Tyrant that  Mali and a Bamako property
Jump to imperial Benin, fifteenth century, trade routes heavy
Break the bank like Musa, mint the gold, truth aplenty

Trauma not an enemy
Perverse German woodcuts could've been Dürer
Three heads on a jackal, fantastic creatures in Africa
Universalis Cosmographia
Sebastian Münster, lying bastard
Wolfman in a Speedo, Cyclops and Chest Master
I first heard Culture on the island of Gorée, international urn
I was twelve years old, still could have gone ofay
So bless that day
And damn the last three centuries2Embed

songs.title: The Doldrums

description.plain:
The doldrums is a specific region of equatorial ocean where there is little breeze. During periods stuck in the doldrums, a ship is unable to move due the lack of wind. The monotony slowly drives sailors to extreme boredom, slowly eroding mental health.

Here the oceanic doldrums are a metaphor for waiting for drug deliveries so you can deal and make money. There are the physical and psychological dangers of the forced wait (“you don’t work, you don’t eat”), the dangers of dealing (“Muchos problemas if you don’t have it for the plug”), and the psychological pressures of the whole cycle/situation (“In tight spaces I learned not to speak”). Dealing also functions here as a metaphor for the larger machine of capitalism, which of course is a recurring theme in woods' and Armand Hammer’s music.

The backing track is built around samples “Images Unseen,” a track from folk-jazz guitar master Ralph Towner’s 1974 solo album Diary.

songs.embed_content: Read “The Doldrums” by ​billy woods on Genius

body.plain:
The doldrums is a specific region of equatorial ocean where there is little breeze. During periods stuck in the doldrums, a ship is unable to move due the lack of wind. The monotony slowly drives sailors to extreme boredom, slowly eroding mental health.

Here the oceanic doldrums are a metaphor for waiting for drug deliveries so you can deal and make money. There are the physical and psychological dangers of the forced wait (“you don’t work, you don’t eat”), the dangers of dealing (“Muchos problemas if you don’t have it for the plug”), and the psychological pressures of the whole cycle/situation (“In tight spaces I learned not to speak”). Dealing also functions here as a metaphor for the larger machine of capitalism, which of course is a recurring theme in woods' and Armand Hammer’s music.

The backing track is built around samples “Images Unseen,” a track from folk-jazz guitar master Ralph Towner’s 1974 solo album Diary.

He got the whole world in his hands, ice cold

Nothin' ever happens 'til it do

Moms shook her head, "you shouldn't wear a dead man's shoe"

songs.title: Versailles

description.plain:
“Versailles” is track ten off of billy woods' and Preservation’s Aethiopes.

The track is named after Versailles, the palace complex outside Paris built by Louis XIV. Historically, Versailles, and France at large, were built off of the slave trade and mass exploitation. Louis XIV’s finance minister Jean-Baptiste Colbert–widely regarded as one of the founding fathers of modern public administration–had figured out a method that ensured France would benefit from the triangular slave trade between Africa, the Caribbean, and North America. Both of them had written a code, called the Code Noir (The Black Code), which laid out how slavery would be conducted across the French Empire.

In this track, however, woods doesn’t use Louis XIV as a direct example, instead focusing on how capitalism at large is a system of exploitation and tackling the facade of the American Dream.

songs.embed_content: Read “Versailles” by ​billy woods on Genius

body.plain:
“Versailles” is track ten off of billy woods' and Preservation’s Aethiopes.

The track is named after Versailles, the palace complex outside Paris built by Louis XIV. Historically, Versailles, and France at large, were built off of the slave trade and mass exploitation. Louis XIV’s finance minister Jean-Baptiste Colbert–widely regarded as one of the founding fathers of modern public administration–had figured out a method that ensured France would benefit from the triangular slave trade between Africa, the Caribbean, and North America. Both of them had written a code, called the Code Noir (The Black Code), which laid out how slavery would be conducted across the French Empire.

In this track, however, woods doesn’t use Louis XIV as a direct example, instead focusing on how capitalism at large is a system of exploitation and tackling the facade of the American Dream.

songs.lyrics:
33 ContributorsVersailles Lyrics

Money spent, it was all pocket change

God bless the child that took yours and got away with it

'Cause every dollar that you drop is stacked on top of their heads
If you want it on the arm I charge an arm and a leg

songs.full_title: Western Education is Forbidden by ​billy woods (Ft. FIELDED)
songs.title: Western Education is Forbidden

description.plain: The title is a reference to Boko Haram, an iteration of the Islamic State in Western Africa. They are currently in decline, but they are based out of Nigeria and also operate in Chad and Cameroon. The name “Boko Haram” means “Western education is forbidden” in Arabic and Hausa.

songs.embed_content: Read “Western Education is Forbidden” by ​billy woods on Genius

Run-flat tires on cars

songs.title: The Wake

description.plain: A Wake is a tradition practiced when someone close has passed away. Friends and family are invited to look over the dead body and they console each other in their grief with prayer and support. With this in mind, Billy Wood’s song, the Wake, is a rather ironic twist on this ceremony. Instead of dwelling on all pleasant memories, he paints unflattering pictures of drug abuse, crime, poverty, loss and dashed opportunities

songs.lyrics:
28 ContributorsThe Wake Lyrics
I stand in this booth in a moment we call now
At the same time, pedaling to school as a child
Under a canopy of jacarandas, it ain't change much
Colorful trees still surround us, L's get touched
Baby-faced, staring out the window of a school bus
Twenty years later, same wistful look but shackled up
Bearded down, momma kissed his forehead good luck
Tears anoint the crown
He lied to her anyway and toasted that night over pounds
Sterling, whispers in whirlwinds
Polaroid pictures, edges curling
At the auction
The contents of one storage space, sight unseen, going once
Sixteen, seventeen, cracking Philly Blunts
Half the smarts, but twice the heart
Look at the picture, eyes had a spark
Sputtering, at the bar mutterin'
Money comes and goes
Broke today, but tomorrow who knows?
Ten years ago she was just some hoe
Five years after that, I'm in love
And if you asked me today, I could give a fuck
Go figure

Ahhhhh
